qas.question: What has been a major factor in the restoration of Estonia after winning their independence?

answers.text: closer ties with the Nordic countries

qas.question: When did Toomas Hendrik Ilves deliver his speech?
Who expressed a speech called "Estonia as a Nordic Country"?
What year did the foreign ministry hold an exhibit exploring the Nordic ties of Estonia?

context: An important element in Estonia's post-independence reorientation has been <a0_0>closer ties with the Nordic countries<a0_0/>, especially Finland and Sweden. Indeed, Estonians consider themselves a Nordic people rather than Balts, based on their historical ties with Sweden, Denmark and particularly Finland. In <a1_0>December 1999<a1_0/>, then Estonian foreign minister (and since 2006, president of Estonia) <a2_0>Toomas Hendrik Ilves<a2_0/> delivered a speech entitled "Estonia as a Nordic Country" to the Swedish Institute for International Affairs. In <a3_0>2003<a3_0/>, the foreign ministry also hosted an exhibit called "Estonia: Nordic with a Twist".
